member.name: T:Json.Schema.OpenApi.DiscriminatorKeyword
member.summary: Handles `example`.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.OpenApi.DiscriminatorKeyword.PropertyName
member.summary: The name of the property in the payload that will hold the discriminator value.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.OpenApi.DiscriminatorKeyword.Mapping
member.summary: An object to hold mappings between payload values and schema names or references.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.OpenApi.DiscriminatorKeyword.Extensions
member.summary: Allows extensions to the OpenAPI Schema. The field name MUST begin with `x-`, for example, `x-internal-id`. Field names beginning `x-oai-` and `x-oas-` are reserved for uses defined by the OpenAPI Initiative. The value can be null, a primitive, an array or an object.

An object to hold mappings between payload values and schema names or references.

Allows extensions to the OpenAPI Schema. The field name MUST begin with `x-`, for example, `x-internal-id`. Field names beginning `x-oai-` and `x-oas-` are reserved for uses defined by the OpenAPI Initiative. The value can be null, a primitive, an array or an object.

member.summary: Provides validation for the keyword.
member.param: Contextual details for the validation process.

member.returns: true if the current object is equal to the other parameter; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.OpenApi.Formats
member.summary: Defines formats used by the OpenAPI v3.1 specification.

member.name: F:Json.Schema.OpenApi.Formats.MediaRange
member.summary: Defines the `media-range` custom format used by OpenAPI v3.1.
member.remarks:
Little is defined for this format except that it is intended to be a media type in line with RFC-7231 https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7231#appendix-D. For more information, see https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/issues/2714.
This format carries no logic and will always pass validation.

member.summary: Provides a fluent interface for .

member.param: The builder.
The name of the property in the payload that will hold the discriminator value.
An object to hold mappings between payload values and schema names or references.

Allows extensions to the OpenAPI Schema. The field name MUST begin with `x-`, for example, `x-internal-id`. Field names beginning `x-oai-` and `x-oas-` are reserved for uses defined by the OpenAPI Initiative. The value can be null, a primitive, an array or an object.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.OpenApi.JsonSchemaBuilderExtensions.Example(Json.Schema.JsonSchemaBuilder,System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode)
member.param: The builder.
The example value.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.OpenApi.JsonSchemaBuilderExtensions.ExternalDocs(Json.Schema.JsonSchemaBuilder,System.Uri,System.String,System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.String,System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode})
member.param: The builder.
The URL for the target documentation. This MUST be in the form of a URL.
A description of the target documentation. CommonMark syntax MAY be used for rich text representation.

Allows extensions to the OpenAPI Schema. The field name MUST begin with `x-`, for example, `x-internal-id`. Field names beginning `x-oai-` and `x-oas-` are reserved for uses defined by the OpenAPI Initiative. The value can be null, a primitive, an array or an object.

member.name: M:Json.Schema.OpenApi.JsonSchemaBuilderExtensions.Xml(Json.Schema.JsonSchemaBuilder,System.Uri,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyDictionary{System.String,System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode})
member.summary: Adds an `xml` keyword to the schema.
member.param: The builder.
The URI of the namespace definition. This MUST be in the form of an absolute URI.

Replaces the name of the element/attribute used for the described schema property. When defined within `items`, it will affect the name of the individual XML elements within the list. When defined alongside `type` being `array` (outside the `items`), it will affect the wrapping element and only if `wrapped` is `true`. If `wrapped` is `false`, it will be ignored.
The prefix to be used for the name.
Declares whether the property definition translates to an attribute instead of an element. Default value is `false`.

MAY be used only for an array definition. Signifies whether the array is wrapped (for example, ``) or unwrapped (``). Default value is `false`. The definition takes effect only when defined alongside `type` being `array` (outside the `items`).

Allows extensions to the OpenAPI Schema. The field name MUST begin with `x-`, for example, `x-internal-id`. Field names beginning `x-oai-` and `x-oas-` are reserved for uses defined by the OpenAPI Initiative. The value can be null, a primitive, an array or an object.

member.name: T:Json.Schema.OpenApi.XmlKeyword
member.summary: Handles `example`.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.OpenApi.XmlKeyword.Namespace
member.summary: The URI of the namespace definition. This MUST be in the form of an absolute URI.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.OpenApi.XmlKeyword.Name
member.summary: Replaces the name of the element/attribute used for the described schema property. When defined within `items`, it will affect the name of the individual XML elements within the list. When defined alongside `type` being `array` (outside the `items`), it will affect the wrapping element and only if `wrapped` is `true`. If `wrapped` is `false`, it will be ignored.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.OpenApi.XmlKeyword.Prefix
member.summary: The prefix to be used for the name.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.OpenApi.XmlKeyword.Attribute
member.summary: Declares whether the property definition translates to an attribute instead of an element. Default value is `false`.

member.name: P:Json.Schema.OpenApi.XmlKeyword.Wrapped
member.summary: MAY be used only for an array definition. Signifies whether the array is wrapped (for example, ``) or unwrapped (``). Default value is `false`. The definition takes effect only when defined alongside `type` being `array` (outside the `items`).

member.name: P:Json.Schema.OpenApi.XmlKeyword.Extensions
member.summary: Allows extensions to the OpenAPI Schema. The field name MUST begin with `x-`, for example, `x-internal-id`. Field names beginning `x-oai-` and `x-oas-` are reserved for uses defined by the OpenAPI Initiative. The value can be null, a primitive, an array or an object.

When defined alongside `type` being `array` (outside the `items`), it will affect the wrapping element and only if `wrapped` is `true`. If `wrapped` is `false`, it will be ignored.
The prefix to be used for the name.
Declares whether the property definition translates to an attribute instead of an element. Default value is `false`.

MAY be used only for an array definition. Signifies whether the array is wrapped (for example, ``) or unwrapped (``). Default value is `false`. The definition takes effect only when defined alongside `type` being `array` (outside the `items`).

Allows extensions to the OpenAPI Schema. The field name MUST begin with `x-`, for example, `x-internal-id`. Field names beginning `x-oai-` and `x-oas-` are reserved for uses defined by the OpenAPI Initiative. The value can be null, a primitive, an array or an object.
